conversation.content:
Write a riveting, interesting, on point and lengthy alternate history scenario in the form of a history book chapter in which the White Russian proto-fascist group manages to win the Russian Civil War and defeat the Bolsheviks due to significant aid and support from the Entente Powers.

Chinese nationalist Mao Zedong, is killed while fighting on the side of the White Russians while Soviet loyalist and KMT party member Chiang Kai Shek [Jiang Jianshi] is slain in battle leading a charge against an assault by the White Russians.

After the end of the Bolsheviks and the subsequent restoration of order in Russia, the White Russians create the Russian Federation, lead by Admiral Kolchak as its Vohzd [Supreme Leader] with Pytor Wrangel as first minister.

Meanwhile, American dictator Woodrow Wilson, considered the world’s first fascist leader, is joyous over the victory over communism in Russia, but is assassinated by a disgruntled civil rights activist, causing the Confederate Democrats and KKK to be eliminated by a series of purges and retaliatory attacks and the New Freedom regime established over the USA by Wilson’s seizure of power in 1912 to collapse.

This destroys the American liberal establishment, and it slows fades into obscurity as the moderate Republicans seize power and work on restoring the USA to a constitutional republic.

Chapter XIV: The Triumph of the White Movement and the Birth of a New World

Section 1: The Ascendancy of the White Movement

In the years following the Great War, the world observed in trepidation as the Russian Empire descended into chaos. Amidst the chaos, two rival forces fought for control of the vast nation: the Bolsheviks, led by Lenin, espousing communism, and the White Movement, a loose coalition of anti-Bolshevik forces, including a significant number of proto-fascist elements. The outcome of this brutal struggle would dictate the shape of geopolitics for the remainder of the 20th century.

The foundation of the White Russian victory lay in the support garnered from foreign powers. The geopolitical reality of the early 20th century saw the Entente Powers invest heavily in the success of the White Russian forces, led by Admiral Kolchak, to prevent the spread of Bolshevism. The United States of America, the United Kingdom, France, and Italy provided not only strategic advice and financial aid but also dispatched their forces to aid the White Russians against their Soviet enemies.

In 1918, a covert agreement between the Entente Powers and pro-independence states within the Russian Empire weakened the Bolshevik forces substantially. This meant that the newly founded nations, such as Finland, Estonia, and Poland, received aid from the Entente powers in exchange for protecting their western borders and ensuring that the frontline of the civil war took place in the heart of Soviet power.

Section 2: A Tide Turns and A Titan Falls

On August 10, 1919, the tide of battle shifted in favor of the White Russians during the epic battle near Lake Onega. Strategically significant Chinese nationalist, Mao Zedong, was killed while leading a volunteer battalion in the service of the White Russian cause. His death dealt a blow to the morale of communist sympathizers across Russia and galvanized anti-communist forces.

In the ultimate irony, Chiang Kai-shek, a staunch supporter of the Bolsheviks, was killed leading a daring charge against the well-entrenched White Russian forces. Despite their brave attempts, the Bolshevik forces were ill-prepared and ill-equipped to withstand the onslaught of the Russian winter, and their forces were decimated.

Section 3: The Formation of the Russian Federation

With the Bolshevik defeat, the formerly disparate elements of the White Russian coalition united under the banner of a newly emerged Russian Federation. Admiral Kolchak rose to prominence as the Vohzd, or Supreme Leader, of the Federation. He consolidated power, appointing Baron Pyotr Wrangel as his first minister. The Russian Federation became a ruthless and expansionist state, seeking to reestablish the territories lost during the Great War and gain further influence across Europe and Asia.

Section 4: The Fall of the First Fascist

America responded jubilantly to the news of Bolshevik defeat, with President Woodrow Wilson regarding it as a justification for his authoritarian rule, which had seen him seizing power in the 'New Freedom' coup of 1912. Widely considered the world's first fascist leader, his policies inspired the White Russians and garnered him immense support among the American population.
This is great, go ahead and continue and finish up while expanding on the concepts presented.

Section 5: The Unraveling of the New Freedom Regime

However, Wilson's iron grip over America did not last long. The assassination of President Woodrow Wilson in 1920, allegedly by a disgruntled civil rights activist, sent shockwaves throughout America and marked the beginning of the end of his New Freedom regime. The assassination also sparked a series of violent retaliatory attacks and purges against the Confederate Democrats and the Ku Klux Klan, eliminating them as significant political forces in the United States.

Section 6: The Moderate Republicans Rise

With the collapse of the New Freedom regime and the decline of the liberal establishment in the United States, the stage was set for the moderate Republicans to assume power. Under the leadership of Charles Evans Hughes, the Republicans worked steadfastly to restore the United States to its constitutional roots as a republic. Through a series of reforms and reconciliations, they worked to bridge the gap between the authoritarian past and the promise of a freer future.

Section 7: The International Fallout

The events in Russia and the United States had a profound impact on world politics in the aftermath of the Great War. The Russian Federation's aggressively expansionist policies alarmed Western European nations and led to a period of tense relations between the two sides. Meanwhile, in China, the power vacuum left by the death of Mao Zedong gave rise to a fractured republic that remained in conflict for decades.

In Europe, the failure of communism in Russia emboldened proto-fascist and nationalist movements in Italy, Germany, Spain, and beyond. These groups became instrumental in shaping the course of European history during the tumultuous interwar period. Fearful of the spread of fascism, the remnants of the liberal establishment found themselves increasingly sidelined, unable to prevent the rise of strongmen figures such as Benito Mussolini and Adolf Hitler.

Section 8: Legacy of the White Movement's Triumph

The entwined fates of the United States and Russia set the stage for the broader arc of the 20th century. The victory of the White Movement heralded the beginning of the age of the authoritarian state, which would reach its zenith during the Second World War. Meanwhile, the attempted restoration of the United States as a constitutional republic sowed the seeds for future conflict with the Russian Federation, which over time evolved into the Cold War rivalry between democracy and autocracy.

In conclusion, the triumph of the White Movement over the Bolsheviks and the tumultuous developments in the United States following Wilson's assassination underscored the global and epoch-making consequences of the struggle during the Russian Civil War. The impact of these events reverberated throughout the 20th century, shaping the political landscape in ways that remain evident to this day. The echoes of this alternate history can still be felt in the present, as nations and their citizens grapple with the legacies of authoritarianism, communism, nationalism, and the struggle for enduring peace and liberty.

The Empress of China is also the President of the federation, and the new Chinese government draws inspiration in its governance style and administration from the now defunct Republic of China [ROC] and the Republic of Vietnam which ruled South Vietnam sometime before and during the Vietnam War. 

The restored Chinese imperial government also takes elements from the Reorganized Government of China regime that ruled parts of China before and during WWII. Vietnam and China become a dual monarchy akin to Austria-Hungary.

Chapter 15: The Reawakening of Empires - The New Order in Asia

The late 20th and early 21st centuries marked a period of unprecedented political upheaval and transformation in East Asia, the likes of which had not been seen since the fall of imperial China in 1911. The dramatic collapse of the Berlin Wall in 1989 not only led to the reunification of Germany and the subsequent restoration of the German Empire, but also triggered a domino effect across Europe and Asia, toppling seemingly invincible regimes and reinstating long-dormant imperial powers. Eastern Europe, the Balkans, and the Caucasus, no longer part of the crumbling Warsaw Pact, were reabsorbed into a revitalized Austria-Hungary and its collection of puppet regimes, eerily echoing the geopolitical landscape of centuries past.

Arguably, the most tumultuous and transformative events took place in China. Following a spate of brutal police crackdowns on protest movements throughout the country, the oppressive grip of the Chinese Communist Party was weakened and ultimately broken by a massive resistance movement; this widespread unrest, which would later be known as the Second Xinhai Revolution, plunged the country into chaos and eventually led to its violent fragmentation. In the wake of the carnage, once-vanquished nations such as East Turkestan, Tibet, Inner Mongolia, and Manchuria all regained their independence, extricating themselves from decades of Chinese subjugation.

As the dust settled on this dramatic reshaping of the political landscape, two drastically different versions of China emerged from the chaos: the Great Qing Empire in Manchuria, ruled by the resurgent House of Aisin-Gioro, and the Mengjiang United Autonomous Government in a portion of Inner Mongolia, led by a sub-branch of the Borjigin clan. Both nations, damaged and dispossessed by Chinese occupation, became protectorates of Japan, with whom they worked closely to rebuild their shattered societies and restore their national identities.

The rise of these new imperial powers in China had far-reaching consequences, both domestically and internationally. Yet nowhere was their impact felt more keenly than in surrounding East Asia, where the region was completely transformed in the shadow of this tectonic shift in global power. The Japanese Empire was reborn, annexing territory from Northern Sahlakin to Taiwan, while the Korean Peninsula experienced a tumultuous transition. The Japanese also supported Asian nationalistic movements and helped them form anti-communist governments in countries such as Vietnam, Laos, Cambodia, and Myanmar.

The aftershocks of China's implosion were felt across East Asia, with authoritarian regimes felled, and various forms of monarchies were reestablished in their wake. The Socialist Republic of Vietnam was replaced by the pro-democracy Empire of Vietnam, while the Islamic Emirate of India was born amid rampant political instability and sectarian strife. Similarly, the Mughal Empire rose to prominence once more in Pakistan, fostering tentative but genuine rapprochement with its erstwhile rival.

In Iran, the Islamic Republic was displaced by the restored Imperial State of Iran, under the governance of the Pahlavi dynasty. In a surprising turn of events, Iran abandoned its ambitions of Middle Eastern hegemony and instead sought to build bridges with its regional neighbors, working in tandem with Iraq, Arabia, and other Arab nations to restore peace and stability to a war-weary region.

The territory of the old People's Republic of China was eventually reconstituted as the Empire of China, a federation drawing on a diverse range of historical influences, from the briefly operational Empire of China established by Yuan Shikai in 1915 to the Republics of China and Vietnam, which preceded its reestablishment. The Empire of China was placed under the control of Pascale Vĩnh San, who was coronated as the Ming Empress and also chosen to serve as the President of the federation, establishing a unique marriage of monarchical and republican political systems.

The dramatic period of political upheaval and rebirth that characterized the late 20th and early 21st centuries in East Asia was a watershed moment for the global order, with long-forgotten empires and puppet states rising from the ashes to shape the destinies of millions. Yet, as the dust settled on this extraordinary reanimation of history, one question loomed large above all others: was this seemingly anachronistic resurgence of nascent empires a sustainable vision for the future, or would these fragile new creations falter and fade into the annals of history once more? Only time would tell.

Chapter 1: Introduction: Setting the Stage for a New World Order

In this alternate history, the 20th century saw a drastically different chain of events that shaped the world as we know it today. The pivotal moment that set these changes in motion came during the Russian Civil War, when the White Russian proto-fascist group managed to defeat the Bolsheviks with the significant aid and support from the Entente Powers. This series of events would have a profound impact on global politics: from the restoration of monarchies across Europe and Asia to the rise of dictatorship and radical movements, culminating in a second world war that had very different outcomes from the one that occurred in real history. 

Withdrawn from the backdrop of this series of events, this book will explore theses scenarios in detail, presenting an intricate and captivating alternate history that shines a light on how a single moment in time can change the course of human civilization. Here, we delve into the complex world of "what ifs" and immerse ourselves in a fascinating, yet different account of the 20th century -- truly showcasing the boundless potential of alternate history storytelling.

Chapter 2: The White Russian Revolution: A Turn of the Tide in the Russian Civil War

As the key event that ignited this alternate timeline, the White Russian Revolution marked a pivotal point in global politics. With the aid of the Entente Powers, the White Russian forces fought tenaciously against the Bolsheviks, leading to the fall of the communist regime and the establishment of the Russian Federation. This chapter chronicles the epic struggle between the two factions, detailing the military tactics, international alliances, and sheer determination that enabled the White Russians to achieve victory in one of the bloodiest wars in human history. 

Chapter 3: The Rise of American Dictator Woodrow Wilson and the Collapse of the New Freedom Regime

Woodrow Wilson, the 28th President of the United States, is often remembered for his key role in shaping global politics in the early 20th century. In this alternate history, however, Wilson's obsession with political power takes a darker turn, as he becomes the world's first fascist leader. This chapter provides a detailed account of Wilson's tumultuous reign, from the support he received from American isolationists to the eventual assassination that plunged the country into chaos and marked the collapse of the New Freedom regime. 

Chapter 4: The Restoration of Imperial China: A Tale of Two Dynasties

The intricate power struggle in China during the early 20th century culminates in the revival of two long-lost dynasties: the Ming and the Qing. With these monarchies backed by powerful nations like Japan and the Russian Federation, Chinese politics take a dramatically different course. This chapter traces the ascension of the Ming Emperor, Zhu Yuxuan, and the restoration of the Qing Empire in Manchuria, as well as the consequences of these events on China's global standing.

Chapter 5: The Rebirth of Monarchies in Europe: The DVNP and the Restored German Empire

As the tide of monarchism sweeps across Europe, the newly-formed German People's National Party (DVNP) comes into power, seeking to restore Germany's status as an empire. This chapter follows the DVNP's rise to power, the coronation of Kaiser Willhelm III, and Germany's subsequent territorial expansion -- showcasing how the German Empire was able to adapt and thrive in this radically different political climate. 

Chapter 6: The Central Powers: A New Alliance for the 20th Century

As the political landscape in Europe shifts dramatically, a new alliance emerges to challenge the established world order. The Central Powers, consisting of Germany, Austria-Hungary, the USA, Romania, Bulgaria, Mexico, Brazil, Japan, the Qing Empire, and the Ming dynasty, seek to protect their collective interests and fight against the aggression of the Entente Powers. This chapter delves into the formation of this powerful alliance, examining the motivations and aspirations of each member state while emphasizing the geopolitical strategies at play.

The former Entente member states face a grim new reality, as their governments are dissolved and replaced by puppet regimes. This chapter examines the postwar settlement in Europe, analyzing the disintegration of the United Kingdom, the rise of the German Empire and its numerous satellite states, and the long-term consequences of these dramatic political changes.

Chapter 12: Mittleafrika: An Experiment in Colonial Administration

Flush with victory, Germany expands its territorial ambitions to Africa, where it recreates Mittleafrika - a vast, centralized colonial administration encompassing much of the continent. This chapter examines the motivations behind Germany's African ambitions, the impact of their colonial policies, and the ongoing contention surrounding Mittleafrika’s legacy in the region.

Chapter 13: North America Realigned: The Annexation of Canada and the Rise of Quebec

North America experiences its own political upheaval, as the United States annexes Canada, leaving Quebec to establish a new, independent state under the rule of the Bonaparte Emperors. This chapter investigates the events leading up to the annexation, the response of the Canadian populace, and the ramifications of these new political entities on North American and global politics.

Chapter 14: The Third Mexican Empire: A Return to Past Glories

Further south, Mexico embarks on a journey to restore its former imperial glory, as it annexes Central America and proclaims the Third Mexican Empire. The House of Iturbide returns to power, ushering in a new age of Mexican prosperity and influence. This chapter delves into the reasons behind this resurgence, the impact of the Third Mexican Empire's rise, and the consequences for regional politics.

Chapter 15: The Fragmentation of Russia and the Ascendancy of Puppet Kingdoms

With the fall of the Entente, the Russian Federation disintegrates, paving the way for the rise of puppet kingdoms backed by both the German Empire and Japan. European Russia becomes the restored Russian Empire, ruled by the Romanov dynasty, while Siberia and the Far East fall under Japanese hegemony. This chapter examines the motivations behind this division, the involvement of foreign powers, and the implications for Russia's long-term future.

Chapter 16: The Greater East Asian Co-Prosperity Sphere: Japan's Sphere of Influence

In East Asia, Japan continues its expansionist agenda, carving out a vast sphere of influence known as the Greater East Asian Co-Prosperity Sphere. Encompassing territories in East Asia and Oceania, this new political entity solidifies Japan's status as a global superpower. This chapter explores the origins of the Co-Prosperity Sphere, its impact on regional and international relations, and the long-lasting effects on the nations under its jurisdiction.

Chapter 17: Conclusion: A World Forever Changed

In conclusion, this alternate history presents a vivid and captivating portrait of a world that could have taken shape had certain key events and decisions played out differently. Through the examination of the rise of the Central Powers, the resurgence of various dynasties, and the shaping of international relations, we gain an appreciation for the role that history plays in shaping our own reality - and the limitless possibilities that alternate histories can offer to our understanding of the world.

conversation.content:
Write an interesting, lengthy and descriptive alternate history scenario in the form of a history book in which the impeachment of Woodrow Wilson in 1913 leads to the collapse of the fascist New Freedom regime occupying the United States and as a result, the Central Powers are able to push into Paris in 1915, causing the French Third Republic to collapse and the British to ask for an armistice after riots spread through the British Isles. 

The following events then happen in chronological order:

Part 1: The End of the War

. In China, Yuan Shikai still dissolves the Republic of China and forms the Empire of China in 1915, but is killed before he can assume the role of Emperor. Zhu Yuxan, the Marquis of Extended Grace, reclaims his proper position as Chinese Emperor, restoring the Ming dynasty as a modern nation-state.

. Tibet and East Turkestan regain their independence and become protectorates of Japan, along with the restored Ming dynasty. 

.Back in Europe, the Armistice signed on November 11th, 1916 sees Great Britain and France secede to the Austro-Hungarian and German empires, and to Bulgaria, all of their West African and sub-Saharan African colonies, while Great Britain secedes the Dominion of Newfoundland in North America to the German Empire, and the French secede the small Overseas Collectivity of Saint Pierre and Miquelon islands off the southern coast of Newfoundland to the Austro-Hungarian Empire.

 , The former Allied colonies in sub-Saharan Africa are merged into the German protectorate of Mittelafrika.

. South Africa itself becomes a kingdom ruled by a member of the Dutch House of Orange-Nassau as its monarch, and is handed to the Netherlands as a show of good will by the Germans.

. Germany also claims French Indochina, merging it with Malaysia and Singapore to form the colony of Deutsch Ost-Asien [German East Asia]. 

.Austria-Hungary reclaims South Tyrol and puppets Venice, and also reclaims the United States of America and Mexico as colonies. The First Mexican Empire is restored as the government of Mexico and British influence is purged from the USA. 

. The United States of America itself is reorganized into the Colombian Federation, with the two-year-old Princess Adelheid of Austria becoming the Kaiserin of the nation.

The KKK and Confederate Democrats that had played a key role in the establishment of Wilson's dictatorship are hunted down and exterminated by the Austrian intelligence agency, the Evidenzbureau, while the American liberal establishment that had supported both factions of terrorists is slowly eliminated from reaching the popular consensus or from having any real power at all by the Hapsburgs.

. The British are forced to hand over Jamaica, British Honduras, the Cayman Isles and the Turks and Caicos Islands to the German Empire, who intergrates these regions into the Kingdom of Prussia. Haiti is also integrated into the Austrian puppet kingdom of Poland, with the Polish King becoming the Emperor of Haiti. 

. Serbia is punished heavily for its transgressions, having Montenegro separated from it as an Austrian satellite kingdom and being forced to admit sole guilt for causing WW1. Serbia itself becomes an Austrian vassal kingdom, with the Obrenovitch dynasty as its royal family.

Part 2: The New Order

With the conclusion of the Great War and the restoration of several monarchies, the world sees a reasonable period of stability. The new national borders foster a sense of balance and peace, while resentments and rivalries continue to simmer beneath the surface.

In Europe, the German Empire solidifies its status as the preeminent dominant power, ensuring stability throughout the continent. The Austro-Hungarian Empire, now expanding to encompass territory on both sides of the Atlantic, faces the difficult task of maintaining control over these disparate lands. To manage these new acquisitions, the Empire turns to a policy of indirect rule, allowing some measure of local autonomy and semi-denominational governments, particularly in Africa and the Americas.

Back in Asia, the restoration of the Chinese Ming dynasty under Emperor Zhu Yuxan proves to be a masterstroke for Japan. As Japan extends its protection to both China and Tibet, the Imperial Japanese Empire emerges as a major player in the world arena. Japan's increased role as a colonial power brings it into conflict with other influential powers, especially the German Empire and the United States.

Part 3: The Interwar Period

The interwar years see an apparent global shift toward monarchy and imperialism. In response, many small nations look to form alliances and build militaries to protect their interests.

In the Colombian Federation, Kaiserin Adelheid von Österreich pursues a policy of national integration and economic development. Working with both the German Empire and the Austro-Hungarian Empire, she succeeds in transforming the economy and infrastructure of the country, while also purging it of the lingering influences of the Wilson regime and the British Empire.

The British Isles, still reeling from the disastrous conclusion of the Great War and the riots that ensue, struggle to maintain social stability and unity. Seeking to avoid any further disorder, they agree to the armistice terms and withdraw from the conflict. As a result, the British Empire, once the world's preeminent colonial power, is now a diminished and struggling entity.

Part 4: Rising Tensions

As Japan grows more assertive in its ambitions, it comes into conflict with both the Colombian Federation and the German Empire. Particularly at issue are Japan's designs on the Philippines and the expanded German Empire's Pacific holdings. Japan's strategic decisions trigger the forming of an alliance among the Colombian Federation, the German Empire, and several other countries, laying the groundwork for a potential second conflict.

The alliance between the Colombian Federation and the German Empire also begins to strain relations between the Austrian and German Empires. Still bitter over the partition of the United States and Mexico, the Austro-Hungarians view the Germans as opportunistic and untrustworthy allies.

Part 5: The Second Great War

On June 19, 1939, Japan declares war on the Colombian Federation, pushing the world into yet another great conflict. The German Empire, along with several other nations, comes to the aid of the Colombian Federation, transforming the conflict into a full-blown world war. Italy, desiring the annexation of Venice, sides with the Austro-Hungarian Empire against the German Empire.

Despite the initial success of the German and Colombian Federation's combined military strength, the war eventually bogs down into a brutal, protracted conflict. The introduction of new and destructive technologies sees the warfar unfolding on land, sea, and airspaces, making it one of the deadliest in human history.

The eventual conclusion of this conflict redefines the global balance of power once more, ushering in an era of uncertainty and complexity that would persist for decades to come.

Write an interesting, lengthy and descriptive alternate history scenario in the form of a history book chapter, in which the impeachment of Woodrow Wilson in 1913 leads to the collapse of the fascist New Freedom regime occupying the United States and as a result, the Central Powers are able to push into Paris in 1915, causing the French Third Republic to collapse and the British to ask for an armistice after riots spread through the British Isles.

The following events then occur in chronological order:

Part 1: The End of the War

. In China, Yuan Shikai still dissolves the Republic of China and forms the Empire of China in 1915, but is killed before he can assume the role of Emperor. Zhu Yuxan, the Marquis of Extended Grace, reclaims his proper position as Chinese Emperor, restoring the Ming dynasty as a modern nation-state.

. Tibet and East Turkestan regain their independence and become protectorates of Japan, along with the restored Ming dynasty.

.Back in Europe, the Armistice signed on November 11th, 1916 sees Great Britain and France secede to the Austro-Hungarian and German empires, and to Bulgaria, all of their West African and sub-Saharan African colonies, while Great Britain secedes the Dominion of Newfoundland in North America to the German Empire, and the French secede the small Overseas Collectivity of Saint Pierre and Miquelon islands off the southern coast of Newfoundland to the Austro-Hungarian Empire.

, The former Allied colonies in sub-Saharan Africa are merged into the German protectorate of Mittelafrika.

. South Africa itself becomes a kingdom ruled by a member of the Dutch House of Orange-Nassau as its monarch, and is handed to the Netherlands as a show of good will by the Germans.

. Germany also claims French Indochina, merging it with Malaysia and Singapore to form the colony of Deutsch Ost-Asien [German East Asia].

.Austria-Hungary reclaims South Tyrol and puppets Venice, and also reclaims the United States of America and Mexico as colonies. The First Mexican Empire is restored as the government of Mexico and British influence is purged from the USA.

. The United States of America itself is reorganized into the Colombian Federation, with the two-year-old Princess Adelheid of Austria becoming the Kaiserin of the nation.

The KKK and Confederate Democrats that had played a key role in the establishment of Wilson’s dictatorship are hunted down and exterminated by the Austrian intelligence agency, the Evidenzbureau, while the American liberal establishment that had supported both factions of terrorists is slowly eliminated from reaching the popular consensus or from having any real power at all by the Hapsburgs.

. The British are forced to hand over Jamaica, British Honduras, the Cayman Isles and the Turks and Caicos Islands to the German Empire, who intergrates these regions into the Kingdom of Prussia. Haiti is also integrated into the Austrian puppet kingdom of Poland, with the Polish King becoming the Emperor of Haiti.

. Serbia is punished heavily for its transgressions, having Montenegro separated from it as an Austrian satellite kingdom and being forced to admit sole guilt for causing WW1. Serbia itself becomes an Austrian vassal kingdom, with the Obrenovitch dynasty as its royal family.

Chapter 8: The World Reshaped: Post-War Consequences of the Fall of Wilson's America

Part 1: The End of the War

The impeachment of Woodrow Wilson in 1913 had far-reaching consequences. His absence enabled the collapse of the fascist New Freedom regime, leaving the United States vulnerable to Austro-Hungarian and German influences. With the weakening of the Allied Powers, the Central Powers saw their chance and broke through the enemy lines, capturing Paris in 1915, and effectively causing the French Third Republic to crumble. The British, witnessing the rapid deterioration in their joint cause, had little choice but to ask for an armistice as riots spread across the British Isles.

The following chain of events unfolded rapidly in the wake amidst this global seismic shift:

In China, Yuan Shikai, who had dissolved the Republic of China and declared the Empire of China in 1915, was killed before he could assume the role of Emperor. Zhu Yuxan, the Marquis of Extended Grace, restored the Ming dynasty as a modern nation-state, reestablishing his position as the Chinese Emperor. Tibet and East Turkestan followed suit, regaining their independence and securing protection under Japan. Japan also became the protectorate of the newly restored Ming dynasty.

Back in Europe, the Armistice of November 11th, 1916, led to the official end of the Great War. Great Britain and France were forced to capitulate, conceding their West African and sub-Saharan African colonies, in addition to other territories, to the triumphant Central Powers. The newly acquired territories were initially divided between the Austro-Hungarian and German empires, as well as Bulgaria. Eventually, these former Allied territories in sub-Saharan Africa would be consolidated into the German protectorate of Mittelafrika.

South Africa, which had deep-rooted sympathies towards the Dutch due to its cultural and historical connections, saw itself transformed into a Dutch kingdom. In a show of good will, the Germans handed South Africa to the Netherlands, placing a member of the Dutch House of Orange-Nassau on the throne as its monarch.

Elsewhere in the colonized world, Germany expanded its holdings in Asia, claiming French Indochina and merging it with Singapore and Malaysia to form the colony of Deutsch Ost-Asien.

In the United States of America, the Austrian-led Hapsburg regime sought to consolidate its colonial authority. After purging the nation of subversive political elements, such as the KKK and Confederate Democrats, who had previously enabled Wilson's dictatorship, the Hapsburgs began a campaign of 'de-Wilsonization.' With the support of the Austrian intelligence agency, the Evidenzbureau, the liberal establishment that had provided the basis for the rise of the New Freedom regime was slowly and systematically stripped of its power.

To solidify their control, the Austrians installed young Princess Adelheid of Austria as Kaiserin and reorganized the United States of America into the Colombian Federation.

Further territorial adjustments occurred across the Americas. The German Empire acquired several Caribbean territories from the British Empire, including Jamaica, British Honduras, the Cayman Islands, and the Turks and Caicos Islands. These territories were annexed and integrated into the Kingdom of Prussia. Haiti, another Caribbean nation, became an Austrian possession and was placed under the rule of the Polish king, who also assumed the title of Emperor of Haiti.

In post-war Serbia, already weakened and demoralized after suffering great losses, harsh consequences were imposed as part of the peace settlement. Having been forced to admit sole responsibility for triggering the Great War, the country was effectively turned into an Austrian vassal state. The Obrenović dynasty was placed on the Serbian throne, and Montenegro was detached and converted into an independent Austrian satellite kingdom.

The world was reshaped in a matter of years. The fall of Wilson's America had left unprecedented consequences in its wake, and the outcome of the Great War stood testament to this. The balance of power had irrevocably shifted, and new alliances and enmities would emerge to define the new international order.

The restored Ming dynasty is a Japanese protectorate, not the other way around.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
   The next chapter should also include the information stated below, expanding on the information presented with each event happening in chronological order:

Part 2: Changes and Adjustments

.The Greater German Empire is declared by Emperor ('Kaiser' in German) Wilhelm II following his armies' victory in the Great War, the integration of Luxembourg into Germany and the transfer of the Sudetenland to Germany by Austria after the war.

.Following the war, the Irish Republic declares its independence from Great Britain on January 21st, 1917.

.Kaiser Wilhelm II immediately recognizes the new state, and even offers to send 50,000 German troops to defend it. The new Irish government accepts this offer.

.The Irish Republic comprises the whole island of Ireland, and it's capitol is in the city of Dublin.

Threatened with a prolonged military conflict with Germany on British soil, King George V bypasses Parliament, and grants Irish independence to the island, himself.

.For this, the mood of the public turns against the king.

.Soon thereafter, the Independent Labour Party begins calling for the formation of a "Workers' Republic in Great Britain".

This is, of course, an act of Treason, and the King declares that His Majesty's Government ought to treat it is as such.

Chapter 9: Post-War Instability and the Emergence of New Powers

Part 2: Changes and Adjustments

With the conclusion of the Great War, the world saw itself adjusting to the new balance of power. Great empires rose and fell, new nations emerged, and revolutionary ideas were conceived.

In the wake of their victory, the German Empire declared itself the Greater German Empire. Emperor Wilhelm II, in his pursuit of territorial expansion, annexed Luxembourg and, with the support of the Austro-Hungarian Empire, annexed the Sudetenland from Austria. This cemented Germany's place as the dominant European power.

In the meantime, the Irish Republic declared its independence from Great Britain on January 21st, 1917. A nation reborn, it encompassed the whole island of Ireland and established its capital in Dublin. Recognizing the unique strategic benefits of a strong alliance with the newly-created nation, Kaiser Wilhelm II wasted no time in offering military support. The Irish government, sensing an opportunity to secure their hard-earned independence, gratefully accepted the offer of 50,000 German troops to defend the island.

Tensions mounted and it appeared that the British would soon find themselves embroiled in another conflict, this time much closer to home. In a risky and controversial move, King George V decided to bypass Parliament and personally granted independence to the Irish nation, preventing a drawn-out and potentially devastating conflict with Germany.

However, the King's actions were not received well by the already disillusioned public. Increasingly distraught by the nation's weakened position on the world stage, the social and political fabric of Great Britain began to unravel.

The Independent Labour Party, a small yet ambitious faction, seized the opportunity to push for the creation of a "Workers' Republic in Great Britain." This revolutionary proposal struck a chord with many Britons, who had become disillusioned with the monarchy and traditional political order in the aftermath of the Great War.

Realizing the inherent threat such an idea posed to the existing political structure, King George V declared the proposition an act of treason. He urged His Majesty's Government to treat it as such, further escalating tensions within the nation.

The post-war era saw the rise and fall of great powers, the emergence of new players on the global stage, and the birth of revolutionary ideas that swept across continents. The instability of post-war Europe would set the stage for a new era of alliances, rivalries, and ideological struggles, as the world found itself adjusting to the drastic changes brought about by the Great War's end.

Part 3: Cresendo of the 20s

. Meanwhile in Manchuria, the Dingsi Restoration lead by royalist Han general Zhang Xun, which aims to restore the Great Qing Empire, succeeds with the covert help of Japan in July 1917.

.In 1923, Prince Lucius William O'Brien is offered the title 'King of the Irish' by the Dáil Éireann, on the condition that he accept that the King's powers would be restricted to mainly ceremonial duties as a constitutional monarch.

The Prince accepts and is officially proclaimed as Ireland's new king on June 7th, 1923.

.That same day, the nation is officially renamed to 'the Irish Kingdom', with the Irish tricolour remaining the national flag.

.Following this proclamation, a new State Crown is constructed, and the new king was coronated on September 30th, 1923 as 'His Majesty King William IV of the Irish'.

.The old Customs House in Dublin is renovated at great expense using funds borrowed from Germany, and converted into the official working residence of the monarchy.

Chapter 10: The Crescendo of the 1920s: A Decade of Shifting Powers and Royal Transformations

Part 3: Crescendo of the 20s

Amidst the global shifts in power and influence in the 1920s, the Dingsi Restoration, a movement led by royalist Han general Zhang Xun, sought to restore the Great Qing Empire in Manchuria. With covert support from Japan, Zhang Xun succeeded in his mission in July 1917. Pu-Yi, the former boy emperor, reclaimed his position as the emperor of the Qing Empire, although this new incarnation was limited to Manchuria.

Over time, the restored Qing Empire became increasingly reliant on Japan, which had already established puppet states in Tibet, East Turkestan, and the reinvigorated Ming dynasty in China's heartland. With Japanese aid, the Qing Empire regained the Transamur region from a weakened Russia.

Meanwhile, in the newly independent Irish republic, the political climate took an unexpected turn. In 1923, Prince Lucius William O'Brien was offered the title of 'King of the Irish' by the Dáil Éireann. The offer came with the understanding that the King's powers would be primarily ceremonial, with the nation continuing to operate under a constitutional monarchy. He accepted the offer and was proclaimed Ireland's king on June 7th, 1923.

On the same day, the nation was officially renamed the Irish Kingdom, and the Irish tricolor was preserved as the national flag. A new State Crown was commissioned, and on September 30th, 1923, Prince Lucius was crowned 'His Majesty King William IV of the Irish.'

Following the coronation, the old Customs House in Dublin was extensively renovated using funds borrowed from Germany and was converted into the official working residence of the monarchy. Renamed "the Royal Palace of Ireland" by King William IV, the palace hosted Emperor Wilhelm II and the Kaiserin of Germany during the grand opening celebrations.

In 1929, King William IV passed away, leaving the throne to his eldest son, who ascended to power as 'His Majesty King Donough of the Irish.'

The 1920s marked a noteworthy juncture in world history as nations moved, adapted, and transformed. The restored Qing Empire in Manchuria, the Irish Kingdom, and dramatic political shifts in Great Britain were but a few hallmarks of this dynamic decade. As the 1920s came to a close, the stage was set for even more dramatic upheavals and events that would continue to shape the world in the years to come.

Part 4: The End of the Red Terror in Russia and the Resurgence of Gallic Fascism

.On January 13th, 1920, Kaiser Wilhelm II announces that the Greater German Empire will intervene in the Russian Civil War in favour of the White Russians and that the Greater German Empire now recognizes Admiral Alexander Vasilyevich Kolchak, as the Russian Federation's official Head of State.

The Kaiser raises 200,000 soldiers and sends the whole of the Imperial German Navy into the conflict. These developments cause the Allies, with whom Germany was at war as enemy combatants, to feel uneasy and wary of their new comrades.

.Field Marshall August von Mackensen is given command of the German expeditionary force in Russia.

As the Kaiser's armed forces went into battle in Russia, they carry with them a new version of the national flag, which is very similar to the German Empire's Black-White-Red tricolour, however, the Coat of Arms of the Greater German Empire is added to the centre of the banner.

. In 1921, following France's humiliating defeat at the hands of the Germans and the years of economic stagnation and hyperinflation which followed the conclusion of the war, the French Popular Party, led by Jaques Doriot, stage a nationwide armed revolt against the French government with the covert help of the royalist organization turned secret society, Action Francaise. 

An avowed Syndicalist and self-proclaimed "national socialist",  Doriot wants to abolish Capitalism and follow in the footsteps of the French Empire created by Napoleon, by establishing a form of government that combines the best aspects of Capitalism and socialism.

He sees the economic misfortune of France as a failure of the Capitalist system supposedly controlled by Jews and exploits the feelings of anger and bitterness of the French people in order to finally overthrow the system and replace it with a Marxist economy, and nationalist form of government. The ensuing conflict came to be known as the 'French Imperial Restoration', and results in a Nationalist victory on November 13th 1923.

The new government renames the nation "the French National Imperial State", and immediately removes French interventionist troops from Russia.

. War hero and charismatic general Phillipe Petain becomes the Marsheal of the restored French Empire, with Doriot as his First Minister. 

.Eventually, Russian Bolshevik leader Leon Trotsky escapes to France from Russia and becomes an influential member of the new French government as the nation's new Minister of Economic Affairs.

. The Russian Civil War ultimately comes to an end on September 4th, 1924, with the crushing defeat of Vladimir Ilych Lenin's Bolsheviks.

.The last Bolshevik strongholds in the Russian far-east fall to the White forces in August of 1924.

.By then, the Greater German Empire has 340,000 troops operating in the Russian theatre, and 340 aircraft.

The Russian capital is transferred back to Petrograd, which is renamed back to "Saint Petersburg".

. Japan puppets Siberia, and forms the Far Eastern Republic as a puppet government of the former Russian East Coast.

The region of Tuva becomes the Kingdom of Tannu Uriankhai, a Japanese puppet state ruled by a local Mongolian noble family as its royal family. 

. Outer Mongolia itself becomes a Khanate ruled by the descendants of Genghis Khan as the new imperial family of the nation and also becomes a Japanese satellite monarchy.

A small part of Inner Mongolia becomes the Mengjiang United Autonomous Government, a Japanese protectorate ruled by Prince Demchugdongrub as its monarch. 

. The Constitution of the dissolved Russian Democratic Federative Republic is restored as the law of the land, and Admiral Kolchak is elected as Russia's president.

.The name "the Russian Federation" is restored as the official name of the Russian state. "How Glorious is Our Lord in Zion", a beloved Russian hymn, is adopted as the national anthem of the Russian Republic.

Chapter 11: Turmoil and Transformation: The Shifting Landscapes of Russia and France

Part 4: The End of the Red Terror in Russia and the Resurgence of Gallic Fascism

The 1920s continued to be a period of immense change, as major powers pivoted and global crises shaped the fates of entire regions. On January 13th, 1920, Kaiser Wilhelm II announced the Greater German Empire's intervention in the Russian Civil War in favor of the White Russians. Recognizing Admiral Alexander Vasilyevich Kolchak as the legitimate Head of State for the Russian Federation, the Kaiser's support came in the form of 200,000 soldiers and the entire Imperial German Navy, all under the command of Field Marshall August von Mackensen.

This German intervention sparked trepidation among the Allied nations, with whom Greater Germany had previously clashed. Marching under a modified banner, the newly revised German tricolor carried the coat of arms of the Greater German Empire at its center, symbolizing the nation's newfound power and ambition.

Meanwhile, in France, feelings of humiliation, anger, and resentment festered following the nation's defeat at the hands of Germany. In 1921, with the support of the covert Action Française, Jaques Doriot and the French Popular Party launched an armed uprising against the French government. Doriot's ideological ambitions aimed to combine the strengths of capitalism and socialism, dismantling the capitalist system he saw as controlled by Jews and to replace it with a unified, Marxist economy.

This conflict became known as the 'French Imperial Restoration,' and ultimately led to a Nationalist victory on November 13th, 1923. The French government renamed the nation to "the French National Imperial State" and removed interventionist troops from Russia.

In the wake of this dramatic change, charismatic general Phillipe Petain became the Marsheal of the restored French Empire, with Doriot serving as his First Minister. Fleeing the chaos of the Russian Civil War, Leon Trotsky eventually found himself in France, where he became an influential Minister of Economic Affairs for the ascendant French government.

The Russian Civil War finally ended on September 4th, 1924, with the decisive defeat of Lenin's Bolshevik forces. Greater Germany's involvement in Russia had grown substantially, with 340,000 troops and 340 aircraft in the theater by the war's end.

In the aftermath, several Japanese puppet states emerged, with Siberia now under the control of the Far Eastern Republic, Tuva becoming the Kingdom of Tannu Uriankhai, and Outer Mongolia transforming into a Khanate governed by the descendants of Genghis Khan. Additionally, a small region in Inner Mongolia became the Mengjiang United Autonomous Government, another Japanese protectorate ruled by Prince Demchugdongrub.

With the Bolsheviks defeated, the Russian capital returned to Petrograd, which was renamed Saint Petersburg. The dissolved Russian Democratic Federative Republic was officially restored, and Admiral Kolchak was elected as the nation's president, with the name "the Russian Federation" once again representing the Russian State. The adored hymn, "How Glorious is Our Lord in Zion," was chosen as the national anthem, symbolizing a new era for the Russian people.

This tumultuous time in history exemplified the power of change and the unpredictable nature of global politics. As the 1920s progressed, the world continued to witness the rise and fall of powers, as well as the emergence of new factions and ideologies that would shape the course of history for decades to come.

Part 5: The Turbulent 40s and 50s

. With communism defeated in Russia and fascism discredited in the United States by the demise of Wilson's "New Freedom regime", the world enters a period of peace, stability and growth. The mysterious demise of the national socialist government of France due to a mysterious explosion in the Palais Bourbon in 1934, leads to the restoration of the Kingdom of France, headed by the House of Bourbon as its royal family.

. France is however forced to end its occupation of the Dutchy of Brittany and the Kingdom of Occitania, which become German puppet monarchies. 

. In 1936, young soldier Francisco Franco leaves the Spanish Army and enters politics, becoming the President of Spain in the General elections. He soon forms an alliance with the fascist Falange and the traditional conservative group CEDA, and works with the Duce of Italy, Benito Mussolini to purge leftist and socialist influence from Spain.

. Franco surprises Europe and the world when he relinquishes power in 1940, making the restoration of the Spanish royal government his last act as Caudilo.  The young Robert, Archduke of Austria-Este, becomes the new King of Spain, with real power in the Spanish government lying in the hands of the Falange and the monarchist Carlists. 

This of course effectively makes Spain an Austrian satellite state, and the Austrians exploit this to destabilize Portugal and integrate it into Spain to form the Iberian Union. 

. Meanwhile, in the Middle East, the Ottoman Empire collapses in June 1940, with the Arab states regaining their independence. 

Arabia itself unites with Mesopotamia, Oman and Yemen under the Hashemites to form the Kingdom of Greater Arabia, while the Turks keep Syria, Palestine and the Holy Land, retaining the Sultanate ruled by the House of Osman as the government of the country and making significant reforms and development. 

. The Hapsburgs also help the fascist Integralists overthrow the dictatorship of Vargas in Brazil in April 1942, restoring the Empire of Brazil ruled by the House of Orleans-Brazanga as its imperial family. 

.The revived Empire of Brazil joins the Iberian Union, marking a return of the days of Hapsburg glory.

Chapter 12: The Turbulent 40s and 50s: The Dance of Peace, Power, and Upheaval

Part 5: The Turbulent 40s and 50s

The world saw dramatic shifts in political ideologies and power dynamics in the decades following the Great War. With communism defeated in Russia and the United States emerging from the shadows of Wilson's discredited "New Freedom" regime, the stage was set for a new era of peace, stability, and growth. Amidst this ever-changing landscape, several key events unfolded across Europe and the Middle East.

A mysterious explosion in the Palais Bourbon in 1934 brought the demise of the National Socialist government in France, leading to the restoration of the Kingdom of France under the House of Bourbon. However, France was forced to end its occupation of the Duchy of Brittany and the Kingdom of Occitania, which consequently became puppet monarchies of the Greater German Empire.

Meanwhile, in Spain, events took an unexpected turn when Francisco Franco left the Spanish Army in 1936 and entered politics. Initially forging alliances with the fascist Falange party and the conservative CEDA, Franco quickly collaborated with Italy's Benito Mussolini to purge leftist and socialist influences from Spain. In a surprising move in 1940, he voluntarily relinquished power, paving the way for the restoration of the Spanish royal government.

Robert, Archduke of Austria-Este, assumed the throne as King of Spain, effectively transforming the nation into an Austrian satellite state. The subsequent integration of Portugal into Spain, facilitated by Austria, led to the creation of the Iberian Union.

In the Middle East, the collapse of the Ottoman Empire in June 1940 saw the revival of independent Arab states. Arabia joined forces with Mesopotamia, Oman, and Yemen under the Hashemite banner, forming the Kingdom of Greater Arabia. Turkey, on the other hand, retained control over Syria, Palestine, and the Holy Land, modernizing its dominion under the rule of the House of Osman.

Further afield, in Brazil, the Austrian-backed fascist Integralists helped overthrow the dictatorship of Vargas in April 1942, restoring the Brazilian Empire under the House of Orleans-Brazanga. This revived empire joined the Iberian Union, marking a return to the days of Habsburg glory.

The 1940s and 1950s were a time of tremendous upheaval and transformation, with major powers reshaping the global order amidst shifting alliances and ideologies. The events of these tumultuous decades continued to reverberate through the world, ushering in new challenges and opportunities for nations and people across the globe.

Chapter 13: The End of Britannia and the Rise of New Powers

Part 6: The End of Britannia

The 1940s continued to be marked by dramatic changes and upheavals. In the United Kingdom, a brief civil war erupted in July 1943 between a fascist coalition led by Sir Oswald Mosley's British Union of Fascists and Sir Arnold Leese's Imperial Fascist League, and an uneasy alliance of monarchist and democratic forces. The victory of the British fascists, aided by covert support from Italy, forced the Windsors and the British government to flee to Canada.

Establishing a government in exile, the Holy Britannian Empire clung to its remaining Caribbean colonies and a small portion of South India. However, the beleaguered empire became internationally recognized as an isolated pariah state.

Afghanistan was handed over to the Imperial State of Iran, while Burma was liberated from British occupation and the Third Burmese Empire under the Konbaung Dynasty was reestablished.

The remainder of the British territories experienced drastic transformations. Ming China reclaimed Hong Kong, although it was forced to share administration with the Japanese Empire. Oceania witnessed the rise of the Centralist State of New Holland in Australia, with Prince Naruhiko Higashikuni of Japan installed as the new Governor-General. New Zealand became the Aotearoan Kingdom of Nova Zealandia, a Japanese protectorate ruled by a coalition of the centrist New Zealand National Party and the fascist Legion. King Korokī Mahuta of the indigenous Māori people also took the mantle as the king of New Zealand.

In response to these sweeping changes, Japan formed the Greater East Asian Co-Prosperity Sphere, aiming to protect Asia from Western exploitation and usher in a new era of development for the region.

However, the victorious British fascists did not enjoy their triumph for long. The German Empire, sensing an opportunity to solidify its control over the region, intervened in the British Isles under the guise of "restoring order." With its armed forces decimated by the civil war, Britain was unable to resist the German invasion.

Consequently, the Germans divided the British Isles into various kingdoms and duchies, installing their own preferred rulers from the House of Saxe Gotha, Wittelsbach, and other German and Austrian noble families.

The saga of Britain's fall from power ushered in yet another turbulent era in world history. As new powers emerged and old empires receded into the shadows, the stage was set for even greater transformations and shakeups in the decades to come.

conversation.content:
Write an alternate history scenario in the form of a history book chapter, in which the openly nationalist and monarchist Việt Nam Quang Phục Hội [Nationalist Party of Greater Vietnam] and Việt Nam Quốc Dân Đảng [Vietnamese Nationalist Party] are the ones fighting the Vietnam War against the Republic of Vietnam backed by the USA, South Korea and the PRC, instead of the Viet Minh. 

The Việt Nam Quang Phục Hội and Việt Nam Quang Phục Hội are covertly assisted in their fight against the Republic of Vietnam and its US Army, CCP and South Korean backers by Japan, who wishes to weaken the power of China and America in East Asia. 

Thanks to this covert support from Japan and the seizure of military equipment from the US Army,  Maoists, and Korean Republicans by the Vietnamese, the North Vietnamese are able to score a decisive victory over the Republic of Vietnam, culminating in the 1975 battle of Saigon.

 Nguyen Van Thieu and his Army of the Republic of Vietnam puppet masters flee along with their loyalists to America, and the rest of the Republic of Vietnam follows the same fate. 

The following events then happen in chronological order: 

. After the fall of the Republic of Vietnam and the unification of the country under the North,  a new government is quickly formed under President Nguyen Van Tam, working to stabilize and rebuild the country.

. The State of Vietnam, created in 1949 and lasted until 1955 when Ngô Đình Diệm overthrew Emperor Bao Dai and became the first President of the Republic of Vietnam, is restored as the rightful government of Vietnam. Ngyuen Van Tam becomes Crown Regent, with high ranking Việt Nam Quang Phục Hội member Phan Huy Quát becoming Chief Minister of Vietnam

. But the new Vietnamese is only a transitionary government for the real purpose of the liberation war, which was to restore the Empire of Vietnam as an independent state free of the influence of French colonialism or Soviet and American imperialism.

.Prince Nguyễn Phúc Bảo Thăng is called out of exile, ironically in France, and becomes Emperor of the Dai Viet and the "lost provinces of the heavenly kingdom", a clear reference to mainland China and the fact that Gia Long of Vietnam considered himself a descendant of the Ming Emperors.


Nguyễn Văn Tâm becomes the Prime Minister of the restored Vietnamese Empire, and free and fair elections are held after the restoration of the imperial government in Vietnam.

. Stunned and shocked by this move, the PRC and CIA both collaborate to fund a republican revolution under renegade marshal Lol Nol in Cambodia, which is later supplanted by the openly fascist and Khmer supremacist Khmer Rouge regime under Pol Pot.

But to the surprise of Beijing, Moscow and Washington, the Cambodian people quickly turn against the new regime and the Vietnamese Imperial Army quickly manages to defeat the Khmer Rouge and restore the Cambodian monarchy.


.Emperor Bảo Thăng wishes to truly reclaim the Mandate of Heaven and sit on the Dragon Throne in Nanjing, but in order to do that, he needs to deal with the two sets of usurpers who have betrayed the Xinhai Revolution and used their warlord armies to occupy countries not part of the Celestial Empire.


.His first target is Taiwan which is occupied by the Soviet-controlled Republic of China, suffering under the rule of the sons of Stalinist strongman Chiang Kai Shek and and the philo communist KMT party.


Although the Republic of China is a brutal one party state controlled by the Chiang dynasty and the KMT, it is backed by the Soviets and Americans who see it as a bulwark against the PRC.


But Emperor Thăng is confident that he can beat the ROC and reclaim the legacy of the Tongmenghui from the opportunists who have seized it to claim power from themselves and exploit the legacy of the Xinhai Revolution to further their cruel ambitions


.Quân Quang Phục [Restoration Army] guerillas enter Taiwan under various guises and begin forming links with pro-democracy supporters and the opposition, fomenting unrest in the Republic of China between the communist government and the growing resistance to the Chiangs and their corruption.


This leads to an all-out rebellion against the KMT which the Vietnamese quickly intervene in on the side of the pro democracy movement, defeating Chiang and the ROC forces with ease. The KMT is disbanded and the Chiangs flee to Moscow, where they live the rest of his life in exile.


.After the fall of the ROC and the expulsion of the KMT, free and fair elections are held under a provisional government led by former IJA solider Lee-Teng-Hui.


The population of Taiwan votes overwhelmingly to return to Japan and so the Vietnamese Imperial Army hands the islands back to a surprised Japan.

In 1982, the Vietnamese government receives a call from Baghdad and a rather interesting offer.


Saddam Hussein, the bombastic and eccentric President of Iraq, has heard of the VNQDP's victory over the PRC, US Army and ARVN junta and wishes to congratulate the Empire of Vietnam on this tremendous victory over the forces of imperialism and reactionaries. 


He also has some rather disturbing information to share with the Vietnamese.

.The Mukhabarat, while doing its daily intelligence gathering across the Middle East and the rest of the Islamic world, has discovered that the CIA wishes to overthrow the democratically elected government of Syria, and place a puppet dictatorship led by rouge Baath party member and SSNP sympathizer, Hafez Al Assad due to the Syrian government's continuous support of Palestine.


The Americans and Soviets are also cynically working together to overthrow the imperial government of Mohammad Reza Pahlavi in Iran and replace it with an Islamic theocracy lead by the disgraced exiled mullah Ayatollah Khamenei, due to the Shah's plans to modernize Iran and willingness to compromise with Saddam on disputed areas.


.Saddam is wondering if Vietnam, and Vietnam's main sponsor Japan, could aid him in stabilizing his rule and preventing the CIA and KGB's schemes for Syria and Iran.

The CIA and KGB have no idea what hit them, one moment America's puppet Assad seems ready to be in place for the incoming coup against Nureddin al-Atassi and Salah Jadid in Syria and the next thing they know, Assad is executed for treason and the fascist SSNP that would have helped Assad to seize power is taken down in a huge crackdown by the Syrian government.


Syria and Iraq agree to cease hostiles and enter into a joint agreement with the Imperial State of Iran to support the Palestinians against the Soviet-backed state of Israel.


.Ayatollah Khamenei and the rest of the Islamic fanatics who were planning to seize control from the Pahlavis and the Iranian Imperial Government are all eliminated in mysterious 'accidents' and their followers handed over to the confused CIA who wrongly assume the mullahs informed the Soviets of their coup plans in Syria.


The Shah continues his reforms and Iran remains an imperial monarchy, free from Soviet influence.

.Thanks to the covert intervention by Vietnam and Japan in the Middle East against Soviet and American meddling, the Syrians are able to easily defeat the Christian fascist Falange Party in Lebanon and humiliate the Israelis when the IDF tries to provide further support for the Falange.

With the recent humiliations in the Middle East and Iran the Soviets have stopped their subversion operations in Europe, Africa, Latin America and the USA and have begun cracking down on domestic dissent and pro-democracy groups inside their wretched empire.


.In the puppet regimes of the Nazi remnant Federal Republic of Germany, which is a puppet of France and England and the German Democratic Republic which is a puppet of the Soviet Union, resistance organizations inspired by the Vietnamese Righteous Army and the Tongmenghui which lead the 1912 Xinhai Revolution rise up and begin gathering strength.


The Nazis in West Germany and the Stazi in the DDR try to suppress these resistance movements but their efforts backfire, only making the growing resentment against the Western and Soviet occupation of Germany after WW2 grow stronger.


.The old black-red-white flag of the German Empire starts to appear more and more in those protests, and "Heil dir im Siegerkranz" becomes the new anthem of the protests in both the BRD (German Federal Republic) and DDR (German Democratic Republic)


The Việt Nam Quang Phục Hội and Emperor Bảo Thăng suddenly have a bright idea and begin making plans on how they can covertly support these rebels.



. The Americans, in the meantime focus on propping up dictators in Latin America and the PRC is slowly showing its true fascist nature, Mao praising Operation Barbarossa as a "liberation war" against Russian and Anglo-American imperialism and making statements revealing that he views the Nazis as the true heirs of socialism and Marxism.


.South Korea follows the mainland Chinese in this regard, Park-Chung-Hee referring to the North Koreans as "vermin controlled by Russia" and condemning the crackdown on the SSNP in Syria after the failed coup as an "assault on national dignity".


.While the Middle East is being stabilized and Western Europe is being rocked by the conflict between the German Nazi and communist occupation regimes set up by the West and Soviets and the resistance groups across Germany, a series of strange events are occurring in Latin America.


.Tiring of the dictatorial rule of the Institutional Revolutionary Party and its endless corruption, royalists and monarchists infiltrate the fascist Gold Shirts and Synarchist Movement and use the networks and support gained by the fascists to overthrow the government in Mexico, restoring the Empire of Mexico and inviting Maximilian von Götzen-Iturbide to rule as Emperor of the Mexican Empire.


In Haiti, opposition groups and devout Catholics opposed to the reign of the Duvaliers overthrow the son of Papa Doc and then establish a provisional government under a regency dominated by a moderate wing of the ruling National Unity Party, announcing the restoration of the Second Empire of Haiti to a stunned and surprised public.


A reluctant Prince Karl-Stefan of Altenburg, the grandson of Archduke Charles Stephen is invited to rule as Emperor Carl Stephan of Haiti and on his coronation the rebirth of the Polish Kingdom is announced, fulfilling the goals of the Haitian Revolution for an independent Polish state in the Caribbean.


But despite the best efforts of the Nazis ruling the BRD and the Stazi-controlled DDR, both occupation regimes in Germany are defeated and the Nazis and German communists flee to the USA and USSR respectively.


.Surprised by the victory of the German resistance, the Polish People's Republic launches an attack on the now free Germany but is defeated by the sheer skill and tenacity of the German people in defending their country from aggression. The Polish Republic is soundly defeated and the Germans take back all the lands they had lost.


Emperor Carl Stephan of Haiti sees the opportunity to reclaim the Haitian homeland, and with the support of Germany is now crowned King of Poland.


.After the stunning victory, the Germans decide to restore the German Empire that was unfairly occupied in 1918, and make Prince Albert of the House of Hohenzollern Albert II of Germany. 

Luxembourg quickly folds and becomes a part of Germany.

Chapter 12: The Rise of the New Order in Asia and Beyond

The period between 1975 and 1985 was marked by dramatic changes in the global political landscape. The victory of Việt Nam Quang Phục Hội [Nationalist Party of Greater Vietnam] and Việt Nam Quốc Dân Đảng [Vietnamese Nationalist Party] over the Republic of Vietnam, backed by the US Army, CCP, and South Korean forces, laid the groundwork for a series of unprecedented events.

With Emperor Nguyễn Phúc Bảo Thăng at the head of a newly restored Vietnamese Empire, and Nguyen Van Tam as the Prime Minister, Vietnam began to expand its influence in the region, ultimately leading to the defeat of the Khmer Rouge in Cambodia and the restoration of the Cambodian monarchy.

Meanwhile, covert support from Japan, aimed at weakening the power of China and America in East Asia, allowed the Vietnamese and their allies to score remarkable victories against adversaries. The combined efforts led to the downfall of the Soviet-controlled Republic of China in Taiwan, the restoration of the Second Empire of Haiti, and the establishment of the new Empire of Mexico.

These events had important ramifications for world politics. Emboldened by their victories, Vietnamese and Japanese leaders continued to forge ahead with their ambitious plans, working in collaboration with Iraq's President Saddam Hussein to foil CIA and KGB plots in Syria and Iran.

The results were resounding, as pro-American dictator Hafez Al-Assad failed to seize power in Syria, the Islamic revolution in Iran was averted, and the Middle East witnessed strengthening ties between regional powers. These changes in the Middle East had significant ripple effects across the globe.

In Europe, the crumbling puppet regimes of the Federal Republic of Germany and the German Democratic Republic sparked a German renaissance, as the old Imperial colors and emblems returned to the streets. With covert support from Vietnam and Japan, German resistance movements stood against their occupiers, eventually leading to the reunification of Germany and the restoration of the German Empire under Prince Albert of the House of Hohenzollern, as Albert II of Germany.

Amidst the tumultuous events of the period, Latin America saw its own share of transformations, as the Institutional Revolutionary Party in Mexico was overthrown, paving the way for the establishment of the Mexican Empire under Maximilian von Götzen-Iturbide.

In Haiti, the overthrow of the Duvalier regime and the subsequent restoration of the Second Empire of Haiti under Emperor Carl Stephan further altered the balance of power. The new Emperor not only claimed the throne of the Caribbean nation but also secured the crown of the restored Polish Kingdom.

These sweeping political changes challenged the established order, marking the beginning of a new era in global history. The surge of nationalist movements, the restoration of monarchies, and the strengthening of ties between these emergent powers would ultimately reshape the world in ways that few had anticipated.

In the years that followed, this new order would face its own set of challenges, as established powers struggled to adapt to a changing landscape. But the dawn of the 1980s had definitively shown that the post-WWII order was no longer sustainable, and a new era had begun – an era in which the ambitions of Vietnam, Japan, Haiti, Mexico, Germany, and their allies would take center stage.

conversation.content: give me a summary of MLK's letter from birmingham jail

Martin Luther King Jr.'s "Letter from Birmingham Jail" is a response to a group of white clergymen who criticized King's peaceful protests in Birmingham, Alabama. In the letter, King defends his actions and explains why he and his fellow protestors are justified in their fight against racial injustice.

King argues that the fight for civil rights cannot be delayed or avoided, and that nonviolent resistance is the most effective way to bring about change. He also expresses his disappointment in the white moderates who have been silent on the issue of racial inequality, and urges them to join the fight for justice.

Throughout the letter, King addresses the criticisms and accusations against him and his fellow protestors, including the charge that they are breaking the law. He explains that breaking unjust laws is a moral obligation, and that the legal system is not always just.

Overall, King's "Letter from Birmingham Jail" is a powerful call to action for all Americans to stand up against racial inequality and injustice, and to use nonviolent means to bring about change.
give me a summary of Morris L. Leibman's "Civil Disobedience: A Threat To Our Law Society"

Morris L. Leibman's article "Civil Disobedience: A Threat To Our Law Society" argues that civil disobedience is a dangerous threat to the rule of law and undermines the integrity of the legal system. Leibman asserts that laws are the foundation of society and that they must be respected and obeyed, even if individuals do not agree with them.

Leibman also claims that civil disobedience is unjustified because there are other legal means of protest, such as lawsuits and petitions. He argues that civil disobedience is fueled by a desire for attention and publicity, rather than a true commitment to social justice.

Furthermore, Leibman suggests that civil disobedience can lead to anarchy and chaos, as it encourages individuals to pick and choose which laws to obey, and creates a culture of lawlessness. He also highlights the potential risks and dangers that civil disobedience can pose to individuals and to the community at large.

Overall,Leibman's article argues that civil disobedience is not a legitimate form of protest and that it threatens the very foundations of our society.
give me a thesis on how MLK would react to Leibman

It is likely that Martin Luther King Jr. would strongly disagree with Morris L. Leibman's argument that civil disobedience is a threat to the rule of law and undermines the integrity of the legal system. King believed that civil disobedience was a legitimate and necessary form of protest in the face of unjust laws and systems of oppression. King would argue that civil disobedience is a powerful tool to achieve social justice and is a means of bringing about change when other legal means have failed. Furthermore, King would assert that obeying unjust laws is itself a threat to the rule of law and that breaking unjust laws is a moral obligation to stand on the right side of history.

2. According to Martin Luther King Jr.'s perspective in his letter, Morris L. Leibman's argument that civil disobedience poses a threat to the legal system and undermines the rule of law would be in disagreement with King's belief that civil disobedience is a necessary form of protest to address issues of social justice and segregation.

logically.

King believed that the laws of the United States had to be respected and followed, but when those laws were unjust and inhumane, they needed to be challenged through peaceful protests and civil disobedience. Meanwhile, imperial count Baisnef of Valdindet, formally subject of empress Auvrittoht, with some support from independent grand duke Feszonmondt of Grand Duchy Skabak, in a successful and daring campaign reconquers the island of Varosia and is elected as emperor of Tzadriel by his supporters. At the same time empress Maiovareia of Esalnira and supreme chieftain Moistin of United Tribes of Bouxermon create an alliance by way of marriage of Maionareta, Maiovareia’s daughter, to Moistin. They will allow Esalnira to create coordination and research facilities on their territory. Esalnira will provide substantial economic assistance to the participants of the treaty. The purpose of the alliance is defeat of Cafonian Sea Khanate, full restoration of Empire of Tzadriel and its authority and division of territory of the states, previously conquered by Cafonia, between the treaty participants. Additionally, the participants will confirm the special status of Esalnira and will support its diplomatic position concerning Mevechelenian-Lubenian conflict and civil war in Lalegria. Restrorigas will be obliged to sign peace treaty with Tzadriel and New Tzadriel, declaring cessation of hostile privateering and establishing a commission supervising the restitution of stolen cargo and reparations for homicide and bodily harm. Some participants will be allowed exceptions to the articles of the treaty: Bouxermon will have complete military and economic sovereignty on its territory and over its military units, it will keep its tribal laws unchanged, it will not acknowledge special status of Esalnira and its conquest of the territories of Grand Duchy of Stralatih will be recognized by all participants; Skabak and New Tzadriel will be able to acknowledge both Auvrittoht and Baisnef as emperors of Tzadriel.
